text:
At least one commercially operated station in the six-state
area has indicated its desire to obtain, for release on a delayed
basis, the programs sent over the network. It stated that it
would be willing to compensate the network in the amount of
$lÂ£,000 per annum for this privilege. It is obvious that if even
ten commercial stations within the six states were minded to take
a similar action network costs could be reduced substantially.
If thirty were to take such action (or only an average of five
per state), almost the entire network costs would be underwritten.
